intro: Senecio memmingeri, commonly known as the Memminger's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in dry conditions. Senecio memmingeri is known for its low-growing habit and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
